intro: Polyosma murudensis, commonly known as the Murudensian polyosma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, oval berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
